ns1:DomainModel.projectDescription: caTIES application version for Grid Reference Implementation is based on this model.

ns1:UMLClass.description: Description made by a pathologist of the gross and microscopic examination of a pathology specimen.

ns2:UMLAttribute.description: The text of the pathology report.
ns2:UMLAttribute.name: documentText

ns2:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A writing that contains information.
Text; the words of something written.

ns2:UMLAttribute.description: A score indicating the quality of the processing and annotation of the report, for use in application developement quality management.
ns2:UMLAttribute.name: qualityScore

ns2:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
Quality; a degree or grade of excellence or worth; an essential and distinguishing attribute of something or someone.

ns2:UMLAttribute.description: Uniquely identifies specimens accessioned into an organizational unit, such as a laboratory.
ns2:UMLAttribute.name: accessionNumber

ns2:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A control number unique to an object, used to identify it among the other objects in a collection.

ns2:UMLAttribute.description: Identifies the original report when the current report is a copy.
ns2:UMLAttribute.name: originalId

ns2:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
Preceding all others in time or being as first made or performed.

ns2:UMLAttribute.description: The gate binary object encoding the text and used for coder processing
ns2:UMLAttribute.name: documentBinary

ns2:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A writing that contains information.
Consisting of two (e.g., units, components, elements, terms, possibilities) or based on two.

ns2:UMLAttribute.description: Age of the patient at the time of specimen collection.
ns2:UMLAttribute.name: patientAgeAtCollection

ns2:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A period or stage in life, usually stated in years since birth.
The act of gathering something together.
A person who requires medical care.

ns2:UMLAttribute.description: Unique identifier unrelated to exiting report identifiers; provides a key for reidentification in appropriate circumstances.
ns2:UMLAttribute.name: deidentifiedId

ns2:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Removal of text elements that would make data individually identifiable.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns2:UMLAttribute.description: Indicates the date and time that the specimen is collected from the patient.
ns2:UMLAttribute.name: collectionDateTime

ns2:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happened. (NCI)
The act of gathering something together.

ns2:UMLAttribute.description: NCI Metathesaurus codes for any concept regardless of semantic type
ns2:UMLAttribute.name: conceptCodes

ns2:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A concept unique identifier within the NCI Enterprise Vocabulary Service's NCI Metathesaurus.

ns2:UMLAttribute.description: The xml representation of the document validated against the chirps schema.
ns2:UMLAttribute.name: documentXml

ns2:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Extensible Markup Language (XML) is a general-purpose markup language for creating special-purpose markup languages. It is capable of describing many different kinds of data. Its primary purpose is to facilitate the sharing of data across different systems, particularly systems connected via the Internet. (from Wikipedia)
A writing that contains information.

ns2:UMLAttribute.description: Unique identifier for pathology report object.
ns2:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns2:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns2:UMLAttribute.description: Indicates the date and time that the specimen is received into the organizational unit
ns2:UMLAttribute.name: receivedDateTime

ns2:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Received; taken, gotten, or acquired.
An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happened. (NCI)

ns2:UMLAttribute.description: NCI Metathesaurus codes for any explicitly negated concept regardless of semantic type
ns2:UMLAttribute.name: negatedConceptCodes

ns2:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A concept unique identifier within the NCI Enterprise Vocabulary Service's NCI Metathesaurus.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

ns3:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The description of cells and tissues made by a pathologist based on microscopic evidence, and sometimes used to make a diagnosis of a disease.

ns1:UMLClass.description: A catagorization of concepts based on a particular context in which the report concept is used.

ns4:UMLAttribute.description: The words or language units by which the concept classification is known.
ns4:UMLAttribute.name: name

ns4:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ns4:UMLAttribute.description: Unique identifier for concept classification object.
ns4:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns4:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns5:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ns6:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A unit of knowledge created by a unique combination of characteristics. (ISO 1087)

ns1:UMLClass.description: The running of a computer application to perform a specific task.

ns7:UMLAttribute.description: The time at which the execution of the application ended.
ns7:UMLAttribute.name: endTime

ns7:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.
the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ns7:UMLAttribute.description: The time at which the execution of the application began.
ns7:UMLAttribute.name: startTime

ns7:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense.
the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns8:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The act of carrying out some order or instruction to accomplish an aim.

ns1:UMLClass.description: A unit of knowledge created by a unique combination of characteristics.

ns9:UMLAttribute.description: The word or words by which a unit of knowledge are known within a terminology system.
ns9:UMLAttribute.name: name

ns9:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

In the Unified Medical Language System (UMLS) of the National Library of Medicine (NLM) the concept unique identifier (CUI) is an 8-character identifier beginning with the letter "C" and followed by 7 digits. Each concept is assigned such a CUI. The CUI has no intrinsic meaning but remains constant through time and across versions.

ns9:UMLAttribute.description: The label associated with a broad category used to group concepts within the UMLS and NCI Metathesaurus.
ns9:UMLAttribute.name: semanticType

ns9:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The Semantic Type is the basic category or categories that describe a Concept. In general, applying semantic types aids in allowing users (or computer programs) to draw conclusions about concepts by virtue of the categories to which they have been assigned. We use a set of Semantic types developed for the UMLS Metathesaurus. There are currently 134 Semantic types in the UMLS.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns9:UMLAttribute.description: Semantic type identifier. A unique identifier for a semantic type where semantic type is a broad category used to group concepts within the UMLS and NCI Metathesaurus.
ns9:UMLAttribute.name: tui

ns9:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The Semantic Type is the basic category or categories that describe a Concept. In general, applying semantic types aids in allowing users (or computer programs) to draw conclusions about concepts by virtue of the categories to which they have been assigned. We use a set of Semantic types developed for the UMLS Metathesaurus. There are currently 134 Semantic types in the UMLS.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns10:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A unit of knowledge created by a unique combination of characteristics. (ISO 1087)

ns1:UMLClass.description: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment.

ns11:UMLAttribute.description: Unique identifier unrelated to exiting patient identifiers; provides a key for reidentification in appropriate circumstances.
ns11:UMLAttribute.name: deidentifiedId

ns11:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
Removal of text elements that would make data individually identifiable.

A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition maintained from generation to generation, a common history and origin and a sense of identification with the group; members of the group have distinctive features in their way of life, shared experiences and often a common genetic heritage; these features may be reflected in their experience of health and disease.
Major living subspecies of man differentiated by genetic and physical characteristics. There are four racial groups: Australoid, Caucasoid, Mongoloid, and Negroid.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
Gender is the assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles.
Birth Date; the calendar date on which a person was born.

ns12:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

ns13:UMLAttribute.description: Indicates if the conceptual referent modifies another conceptual referent.
ns13:UMLAttribute.name: isModifier

ns13:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true. The indicator usually takes the form of a single binary digit, or bit (either 0 or 1). (from Dictionary of Computers)

A term that helps define and render a concept unique. Criteria that further defines or describes a specific aspect (object class, property, representation) of a Data Element Concept or a Value Domain. (NCICB)

ns13:UMLAttribute.description: The indexed position of the last character of the conceptual referent, where zero is the first character of the entire report.
ns13:UMLAttribute.name: endOffset

ns13:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.
The distance between a point and a fixed reference point; difference between a set point and the actual reading.

ns13:UMLAttribute.description: Contiguous document text that generated the concept.
ns13:UMLAttribute.name: documentFragment

ns13:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A part of a larger entity.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns13:UMLAttribute.description: Indicates if the concept is negated.
ns13:UMLAttribute.name: isNegated

ns13:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true. The indicator usually takes the form of a single binary digit, or bit (either 0 or 1). (from Dictionary of Computers)

ns13:UMLAttribute.description: The indexed position of the first character of the conceptual referent, where zero is the first character of the entire report.
ns13:UMLAttribute.name: startOffset

ns13:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense.
The distance between a point and a fixed reference point; difference between a set point and the actual reading.

ns14:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Something referred to; the object of a reference.

ns15:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A unit of knowledge created by a unique combination of characteristics. (ISO 1087)
